1:
Does not man have hard labor on earth?\q Are not his days like the days of a hired man?
\q
2:
Like a slave earnestly desires the shadows of evening,\q like a hired man looks for his wagesâ€”
\q
3:
so I have been made to endure months of misery;\q I have been given trouble-filled nights.


\q
4:
When I lie down, I say to myself,\q 'When will I get up and when will the night be gone?'
\q I am full of tossing to and fro until the day's dawning.
\q
5:
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust;\q the sores in my skin harden up and then dissolve and run afresh.


\q
6:
My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle;\q they pass without hope.
\q
7:
God, call to mind that my life is only a breath;\q my eye will no more see good.


\q
8:
The eye of God, who sees me, will see me no more;\q God's eyes will be on me, but I will not exist.
\q
9:
As a cloud is consumed and vanishes away,\q so he who goes down to Sheol will come up no more.
\q
10:
He will return no more to his house;\q neither will his place know him again.
\m


\q
12:
Am I the sea or a sea monster\q that you place a guard over me?


\q
13:
When I say, 'My bed will comfort me,\q and my couch will ease my complaint,'
\q
14:
then you scare me with dreams\q and terrify me through visions,
\q
15:
so that I would choose strangling\q and death rather than preserving these bones of mine.


\q
16:
I loathe my life; I would not wish to always be alive;\q let me alone for my days are useless.
\q
17:
What is man that you should pay attention to him,\q that you should set your mind on him,
\q
18:
that you should observe him every morning\q and test him every moment?


\q
19:
How long will it be before you look away from me,\q before you let me alone long enough for me to swallow down my own saliva?
\q
20:
Even if I have sinned, what would that do to you, you who watch men?\q Why have you made a target of me,
\q so that I am a burden for you?


\q
21:
Why do you not pardon my transgression and take away my iniquity?\q For now will I lie down in the dust;
\q you will seek me carefully, but I will not exist."
